data.author: Bottmzup
data.content: How many more clues does the market need to rate ECR much higher than it is at the current share price? It seems that every trader/investor has been spooked by the recent 'crash' in the gold price...from the spectacular run up to $5100, to then get manipulated down to as low as $4400...and now regaining some of that fall, currently at $4850! The share price here seems to be tracking every rise and fall in the gold price as if we've been a producer for a long time. What seems to be getting overlooked with ECR, is that we are only just transitioning from a junior explorer to a very promising producer, for the first time in their 25 year history, with clear evidence that we are now in the very strong position of actually creating cash flow from Raglan NOW (see pictures of first gold recovery), and in an already comfortable financial runway situation with £1.5m in the bank after the recent placing. Also they have just announced a soon to be completed, this month, offtake partner deal to sell the incoming gold, at a time when the weather is set to get historically more favourable going in to Feb, March and beyond etc. The original calculations for a profitable return at Raglan was at a gold price of $2790 if I remember correctly....something of that order, and yet after confirming that a team had been selected to work on site, after posting pictures of first gold recovery, the plan for optimum geological targets being formulated for maximum return..................AND....the cherry on the cake, A$76m in historical tax losses to offset against future revenues...(so tax free production for years)...the share price, or should I say the participants in any investment in companies with Gold attached to their activities, is still stagnating under recent highs! I know that the market likes to have confirmed production figures before some of the 'frightened of their shadows' participants take a punt, but this has to be one of the stand out favourable risk/reward plays in the small cap gold production companies...anywhere, let alone one of the most lucrative regions on Earth!!! How many clues do they need, with the POG still holding above $4800/oz? Wakey wakey!!

data.content: If you do the maths (I'll do this in US$ to make it easy): We will have around 200 production days a year Running costs per day $2000 At current prices if the get 1 oz per day of gold = $3500 profit/day -  $700k a year 2 oz increases to $8500 a day = $1.7m a year Based on 60tph and 0.35 bcm we previously calculated up to 4oz per day which would be £20k profit or $4m a year In reality they will probably fall somewhere between the US$1.7m and US$4m profit range....and that's PER SITE So the BM & Raglan profit estimation of a$3m (approx US$2m) forecast for two sites looks conservative IMHO

data.author: Bottmzup
data.content: There's a guy called Jim Rickards, economist, lawyer etc, who has been part of the US Govt advisory team in times of recession, like the 2008 crash, when he was part of a team that encouraged 16 of the major banks and financial institutions to bail out the sub prime mortgage holders, and therefore put a halt to the domino effect of the market crash. He has written many books on the world economies, how they succeed, how they fail, and how to stablise crashes. I read one of his books called The Road To Ruin, and in it he explains that in the following recession after 2008, the Govt's will have to bail out the banks...and then the subsequent crashes after that....who's going to bail out the Govt's?....the World bank, the IMF etc etc. A fascinating book. Anyway, he's a regular contributor on global financial platforms and US TV stations  because of how knowledgeable he is on the global economy, the Federal Reserve, interest rates, inflation etc. He has been calling $5000/oz Gold for a few years, because he has that kind of insight on how the financial mechanisms work. Now he's calling $10,000/oz in a shorter time frame.....and thats the point of my post. He explains the simple maths involved as the price rises. When Gold is at $2k/oz, and then rises to $3k/oz...its a 50% rise At $3k/oz if it rises to $4k/oz......its a 30% rise $4k/oz rising to $5k is a 25% rise $5k rising to $6k is a 20% rise $8k rising to $9K is a 12% rise and $9k rising to $10k is an 11% rise! So each rise higher has less resistance, because its a smaller % increase. He thinks that Gold will move rapidly through the gears, because in the current global economical conditions.....there's nothing stopping it!!!

data.author: Bottmzup
data.content: Nick Tulloch does like to keep shareholders informed, almost to a fault, and some have criticized him (guess who) claiming that he's not saying anything new. But most of the time he is adding to what is already known in the market. When Nick and Mike W took over in Sept '23, their distinct goal was to increase value for shareholders by selling non core assets, machinery and property, and using the funds to drill and explore the main assets, keep costs down by taking their remuneration largely in shares, and maintain a sensible approach to funding. As they continued to do what they said they would I became more and more convinced that these two were doing exactly what they said they would, and thats why I continued to build my position, buying the dips. But it wasn't only because they were doing what I thought was the best strategy, it was because of the assets...I was investing in the great locations, the size of the tenements, the massive tax loss situation, and the continued assay results showing that we 'have something good happening'. Then there was the appointment of the requisite experts to move things forward on multiple fronts, in the most professional of ways. Fast forward to Raglan and they played a blinder raising the funds to make the aquisition quick.....before anybody else could get their hands on it. We will get a full report on exactly what has been happening in Aus, and decided upon, either next week or the week after. I can't wait to read it, and then watch the inevitable interviews that always follow any new significant updates. Hopefully it will be a string of positives, followed by a favourable market reaction.

data.author: HarChris
data.content: Whilst ECR should be a comparatively low cost miner that would make profit even in a bear market what with Raglan & BM being alluvial (certainly sub $1000/oz aisc when converted) the higher gold price particularly benefits ECR as it buys eons of time for a slower start/ teething problems which are always possible for a project like this. For me it’s now highly unlikely with gold over $5000/oz and £1.5m in the bank that there will be any further discounted AIM placings and that makes it worth holding firm no matter what share price appreciation we see throughout this year, whether that’s 0.5p, 1p or even higher.

data.author: Bottmzup
data.content: Expected 2026 Operational Milestones ECR enters the new year with a focused and deliverable plan: · Raglan: Commencement of first alluvial gold production, following completion of acquisition (tick), site preparation (tick) and mobilisation of personnel (tick). · Blue Mountain: Progression towards early-stage production, building on visible gold, expanding mineable corridors and further wash-plant trials. · Operational integration between Raglan and Blue Mountain, seeking to establish a scalable, repeatable alluvial production model. · Lolworth: Ongoing exploration for gold, silver and REE targets. · Progression of the proposed Creswick JV discussions with Bold Gold. · Strategic use of the aggregate A$76m of ECR and Raglan tax losses, expected to materially enhance early-stage future profitability for Raglan and Blue Mountain.

data.author: Bottmzup
data.content: Great to see ECR trading comfortably in a higher range, so soon after a placing, and now almost 40% higher, with no big selloff......and, before the first production figures are announced. Good chance of RNS next week, so plenty of FOMO buying driving this supported rise...along with Gold challenging $5000/oz! Favourable weather conditions throughout Jan, so ideal opportunity for a good start. Jan is the highest rainfall month according to historical data, so we've been very lucky. Now, going forward, the months get progressively lower rainfall. ECR's coming of age to a Gold producer looks to have a set of lucky tailwinds.
